--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vilhellm@...> wrote:
>
> Hey Jessie, welcome to the forum. There are lot's of web based 
> resources with different suggestions on recording evp's but the #1 
bit 
> of advice is to make certain other people nearby are speaking. The 
mic 
> can be more sensitive than your ears and the recording is 
amplified so 
> contaminated evidence is always a concern. If you're recording 
with 
> other folks make sure no one whispers, if they do announce out 
loud 
> ythe name of the person and announce that they whispered. EVP's 
often 
> sound like a whisper and usually have a different accoustic 
quality, 
> ex: the room noise or echo sounds different.
> 
> If you don't have audio editing software check out "Audacity". 
Just 
> Google it, it's a free download. You'll want to transfer your 
files to 
> a computer and sometimes filter out hum but be careful not to over 
> filter. You can also cut down long recordings into reasonable 
sizes. 
> 
> Although, people have recorded EVP's in many different places, try 
> locations that you can connect with emotionally. This facilitates 
a 
> possible psychic connection which some people theorize helps get 
> successful recordings.
> 
> We'll be listening , Bill
>
